SENT.plain: Transmission electron microscopy of the middle cerebral artery from cats exposed to subarachnoid injection of blood 3 and 7 days before, showed several damage of the vascular ultrastructure
The intima was thickened with swelling and vacuolization of endothelial cells, with a plump appearance and disruption of tight junctions
The cellular surface was corrugated and the subendothelial space contained proliferating and vacuolated smooth muscle cells capped by elastin and collagen fibres
The internal elastic lamina was also corrugated and disrupted

The adventitial changes were axonic cytoplasmic and mitochondrial swelling, virtual absence of synaptic vesicles, and disruption of the outer axonal membrane, suggesting denervation of cerebral vessels
With administration of 6-hydroxy-dopamine (6-OHDA), similar ultrastructural changes were observed in the adventitia
These observations indicate that denervation induced by subarachnoid bleeding could be involved in the pathophysiology of cerebrovascular spasm
Subarachnoid haemorrhage, but not 6-OHDA, affects also intima and tunica media, suggesting other mechanisms, in addition to denervation, can participate in the vasospasm
